shaky.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: weak and unsteady because of old age, illness, or shock
shaky.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Grandad was a little shaky on his feet (=not able to walk very well).
shaky.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: not sure about the exact details of something, or not likely to be completely right
shaky.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: My knowledge of history is a little shaky.
shaky.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: not definite or firm, and likely to fail
shaky.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: The market began a shaky recovery.
After a shaky start at the beginning of the decade, the economy began to grow fast.
